;

;At 9:30 am on October 26, 1909, Congkuanchengzi (;Changchun;) Ito Hirobumi, who arrived in Harbin by special train, stepped off the train. A short man wearing a peaked cap and western clothes calmly touched his chest, ribs, and abdomen. He fired three shots and then fired four shots at the accompanying Japanese officials, shouting "Ula Golia!" in Russian.

;

;The incident happened suddenly, and everyone was still dreaming. Ito Hirobumi was put on a special train and died 30 minutes later. The man with a resolute face, An Zhonggen, was captured in an almost tragic manner; the seven gunshots fired over the Harbin Railway Station, which was built in 1899 and named in 1903, rapidly and profoundly changed the 20th century. The situation in Northeast Asia at the beginning - Although the train station was demolished and rebuilt in 1959, there are still vivid traces of this incident in the station, including the Ahn Jung-geun Memorial Hall and the platform where the incident occurred: the "Δ" and "□" on the ground , respectively, where Ahn Jung-geun and Ito Hirobumi are standing, about 5 meters apart.

;

;;

;

;Old scene of Harbin Railway Station;(Zhang Yameng/picture);

;

;Just like Ruo Ge As Li said, "When poems and legends are silent, only buildings speak." - Around the train station, everything is completely different from what it was more than a hundred years ago. Only the Church of Saint-Iver still quietly "leans" on it. Stand aside.

;

;;Street: "The Cross-Communication of Multiculturalism";

;

;The "Old Harbin" without city walls is actually neither ancient nor modern - it is The "modern city" grew up amid the roar of trains. China's defeat in the Sino-Japanese War and many factors such as Tsarist Russia's use of alliance with Japan as bait to seize more interests in Northeast China gave birth to the construction of the Middle East Railway. In 1896, Russia obtained the right to build the Middle East Railway. In June of that year, Russia's Middle East Railway The General Administration of Construction moved from Vladivostok (;Vladivostok;) to Harbin. At the same time, the railway was divided into The six ends of the east-west and south-west lines are being constructed in opposite directions at the same time. As the center of the 2,500-kilometer "T"-shaped railway that runs from Manzhouli in the west, Suifenhe in the east, and Lushun, Dalian in the south, it has quickly become an international city with "sky-high buildings, merchants, soaring land prices, and every inch of land is precious." - "The desolate wilderness turned into a prosperous port in an instant." Capitalism has become the "power" for Harbin's rapid growth and rise, but at the same time, foreign capital has inhibited and hindered the development of national capitalism, making it an "alien" between traditional Chinese cities and modern capitalist cities; a railway has even more influence on Harbin. The local architectural culture has had a huge impact, with a wave of compulsory and replacement architectural design trends - integration, addition, mutation... In the silent dusk more than a hundred years ago, in this city with wonderful characteristics, it began Continuously “cultivating”.

;

;;

;

;Today's Harbin Railway Station and St. Iver's Church;(Meng Huizhong/Photo);

;

; Red Army Street, which shoots out straight from Harbin Railway Station, was originally named Horvat Street. It is the starting point and germination of Harbin's city construction. It spreads outwards with it as the axis, showing the annual rings of the city's growth. The original site of the Longmen VIP Building was built in 1907. At the other end, there were the Russian Consulate General in Harbin and the Officers Club of the Russian Trans-Amur Military District, as well as the "famous" Yamato Hotel in the Northeast; the Sino-Russian Daosheng Bank, built in 1920, is now It is the Heilongjiang Provincial Research Museum of Literature and History, still maintaining the original French Renaissance style; the Cheschakov Tea House’s mixed classicism, baroque and Renaissance style exterior bay windows, overhanging awnings, and open-air balconies are set among the Among the green trees, looking at the signboard of "HSBC Camera Company", it is difficult to imagine that it was designed by Zhdanov, a Russian Jewish architect who has lived in Harbin for 37 years.

;

;Red Army Street and the east-west Dazhi Street once intersected at the ancient Gothic wooden structure St. Nicholas Church. Nowadays, there is no trace of the Church of San Nicola. The International Hotel built in 1937 looks like a huge accordion. Opposite it is the former Italian Consulate, the Gibelosso building built in 1919, which is full of exquisite reliefs. The octagonal exterior walls are stacked upward layer by layer to form a lovely eclectic building dominated by Baroque style.

;

;Another group of "solemn vs. cute" buildings is on Dazhi Street. The famous "big stone house" Harbin Railway Bureau Office Building was completed in February 1904 as the Middle East Railway Administration. Magnificent, majestic and dignified, it is like a "huge castle"; the Harbin Railway Museum, just across the street, has a simple interior decoration, while the exterior maintains the yellow and white colors from its days as the Middle East Railway Club, full of joy. breath.

;

;The "Lama Terrace" where St. Nicholas Church is located is the highest point in Harbin. It can be protected from floods when the Songhua River rises. Therefore, starting in 1899, Russia began to regulate the location of this place. The Qinjiagang area (;now Nangang District;) is undergoing large-scale urban construction. Within five years, the China Eastern Railway Administration Building and the Moscow Shopping Mall Building were built. (;Today's Heilongjiang Provincial Museum;) and other European-style buildings were completed, and the east-west axis of Qinjiagang - Horvat Street, Dazhi Street and Main streets such as the New Business Street (;today's Guogol Street;) were built. In the 1930s, the Qinjiagang area had "grand buildings, neat streets", "fresh air and fragrant flowers". Most foreign consulates were concentrated here, becoming Harbin's administrative center and a gathering place for foreigners.

;

;;

;

;Qiulin Company located in Nangang District today;(Meng Huizhong/Photo);

;

;East and West The various subsystems of Fang civilization collide, rub, infiltrate, and blend with each other here. The unprecedented integration of the architectural culture of various ethnic groups in the world presents a "cross-communication of multiculturalism." The Middle East Railway brought a large number of overseas Chinese - according to statistics, in 1923, the total population of Harbin reached 400,000, with nearly 200,000 overseas Chinese and more than 180,000 Chinese. Twenty or thirty years after the Russo-Japanese War, Harbin has become an international city. It brought Russian culture, Jewish culture, Japanese culture, Tatar culture... and nearly 70 churches including St. Nicholas Church, St. Sophia Church, and the Church of the Annunciation.

;

;Zhdanov is to Harbin what Hudec is to Shanghai. Among the three churches "clustered" on Dongdazhi Street, the Church of Our Lady of Saints and Saints designed by Zhdanov (;The Church of Our Lady of Protection;) is the most eye-catching. This Byzantine-style church is said to have preserved the 2,600-kilogram bell that was cast in Moscow in 1899, but it is not available to see now. What can be seen is the notice board erected next to the church: "Please pay attention to your behavior, God is working." Watching you”.

;

;;Church: Bells Echoing;

;

;Unlike the Virgin Mary Church, which is located on the busy main road of the city, the Tatar Church, also designed by Zhdanov The Tai Mosque is hidden among the residential buildings on Tongjiang Street. The red and white walls are full of Byzantine style of quiet and dignified temperament. It is like a "mysterious little castle". Especially at dusk, it has a sense of simplicity. From 1899, when the first Russian Jew, S. I. Berzeri, came to Harbin to the 1940s, countless Jews came to this "second home" and built buildings here, including a hexagonal church with a dome holding up the Shield of David. Many Jewish buildings including the Star Synagogue.

;

;;

;

;Tatar Mosque;(Meng Huizhong/Photo);

;

;At least a hundred years ago, the majestic The bells once echoed over Harbin. In the sound of the bells, expatriates from all over the world, adventurers and exiles of all kinds stopped to listen and found a moment of solace in their hometown in this foreign land.

;

;The symbol of Harbin - St. Sophia Church, the melodious bells played on important religious festivals can be said to be the deep memory of the city for the older generation of Harbin people. It is said that in the church on a snowy day in winter, the Byzantine-style appearance can allow more snow to stay on the surface of the building. The wind blows the snowflakes, which are like the ultimate romance in a crystal ball; on a snowy night, the church will turn into gold bricks. The castle with bright tiles and the towering cross are like stars in the night sky.

;

;;

;

;Hagia Sophia on a snowy night, the scenery is as dreamy as a crystal ball. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;If you want to observe the details of the church quietly, the best time is at dusk. The full dark green dome full of momentum is lifted very high by the main body of the clear red brick building. The golden cross shines brightly, showing a dynamic beauty of rising successively. Viewed from the side, the tops of the four tents are staggered, and the slanting light shines on it. The architectural details cast mysterious shadows, honest and simple. Step into the church and enjoy the daily rotating concerts, as well as the mottled walls and Roman-style arched windows.

;

;The setting sun reflects on the top of the church, which reminds people of its sister with the same name on the other side of the Eurasian continent, and also allows people to relive the rich history of the city's past. In fact, this church had "humble origins" and was only the military chapel of the 4th Infantry Division of Tsarist Russia in Eastern Siberia. In March 1907, it was renovated with funds from the Russian businessman Cheschakov, whose home was on Red Army Street. In 1912 A layer of bricks was laid on the original foundation. In 1923, the Russian architect Kasikov re-selected a site in the southeast corner of the old church and built it. It was completed in November 1932, giving it what it looks like today.

;

;;

;

;Concert in Saint Sophia Church;(Meng Huizhong/Photo);

;

;Saint Sophia The architectural style and decorative style of the church draw on the Russian brick carving art of the 17th century. The St. Alexeev Church at the corner of Gogol Street and Shikes Street organically combines a huge building volume with facade brick decoration. Giving it a strong Russian accent and unique mood. Although this century-old building, which was originally an Orthodox church and was converted into a Catholic church in 1980, also has a majestic and scattered beauty. Even under the clear blue sky in the northeast, it can be regarded as the appearance of the city's architecture, but it is not as lively as Sofia Square. There are very few people around after sunset.

;

;;Lights;;: Chinese Baroque;

;

;Qiulin Kvass rustles after opening the bottle cap. This famous drink looks like Beer, slightly red in color but with only 1% alcohol content, is very suitable for "bottle blowing" when traveling and hiking - such as walking from Alexeev Church, along Gogol Street to the L-shaped building built in 1908 A grand building with a light green tone - Qiulin Yangxing.

;

;There are many old buildings on Gogol Street, but while maintaining their former glory, they have inevitably declined and become dilapidated - just like Daowai District. To the north from the train station, east of the railway across the river, is the Daowai District, formerly known as "Fujiadian", where immigrants from Shandong and Hebei settled in Guandong. Although it is one of the earliest urban centers in Harbin, due to the lack of complete and precise planning, in the 1930s the streets here were "narrow and uneven" and "everywhere you go is so disgusting that you have to cover your nose and avoid it."  ——The folk proverb at that time said: "Nangang is heaven, inside the road is the world, and outside the road is hell."

;

;Unique "Chinese Baroque" architecture also grew here. Along the street, the Western Baroque facade is used, while incorporating the auspicious decorative patterns of traditional Chinese architecture. Iron railings or "Guanyin bottle"-style concrete railings are set up on the edge of the protruding platform. Stepping inside, it is purely a northern courtyard. The architectural shape combines earth and western elements, giving it its own charm. The Chinese Baroque neighborhood, which is mainly located on South Second and Third Streets and has been renovated into a tourist attraction, is lackluster. Many of the green brick streets and wide courtyards have been transformed into catering shops. They are more organized but lack the liveliness and prosperity of the past.

;

;In contrast, the "Chinese Baroque" on Dong Jingyu Street in the neighborhood is the most authentic. Originally built in 1890, this long street was originally called Zhengyang Street. It is also the birthplace of Harbin's national commerce: Zhengyang Tower, Laodingfeng, Shiyitang, Daluoxin Department Store, Hengdeli, Tongji Shopping Mall... every inch of land Jin's Old Street used to be lined with businesses. At the intersection of Jingyu Street and Nantou Street, the four-story brick and wood structure Purification Hospital was built in 1920. It was formerly known as Tongyi Qinghuo Store. It is one of the masterpieces of "Chinese Baroque": the swaying reliefs of vine flowers from Ioni The exterior walls of the sub-column and Corinthian columns are winding all the way down, and the gorgeous and luxurious style is unforgettable, fully reflecting the hope of fame of the national industrial and commercial people at that time.

;

;;

;

;Purification Hospital located outside Laodao;(Meng Huizhong/Photo);

;

;All famous, Prosperity and bustle have their end. Today's Laodaowai has lost its popularity due to large-scale construction, and its decline is fully visible: dilapidated buildings can be seen along the street, and the roofs are covered with decaying grass, as if the old buildings are sighing; the cats and dogs wandering on the street look full of vicissitudes of life. Feeling; beside the ruins, you can occasionally see small electric cars with the sign of "darning", which is a common livelihood for middle-aged and elderly women in the Northeast - sewing.

;

;In old Harbin, if the window of "Zhong" is "Zhengyang Street", the epitome of "West" is Central Street - in Xiao Hong's pen, the city street is like a "complex and unclear color" "Map", Harbin today has similar characteristics - it is also a commercial street, Jingyu Street outside the road has become a large construction site, and Central Street inside the road, at 7 o'clock in the morning, there are tourists wandering around carrying kvass bottles.

;

;;

;

;Street scene in Laodaowai;(Meng Huizhong/Photo);

;

;"Night, spring night, Central Street is a night full of music. Music from homeless people, music from Japanese dance halls, music from foreign restaurants... After 7 o'clock, in the middle of Central Street, at a crossroads, the loud loudspeaker screamed, this The singing almost resounded throughout the street." Xiao Hong once wrote about Central Street in "Spring Hangs on the Treetops", with a lot of irony and banter; however, the "gradually countless" things she recorded were "like long ropes pulled in the sun" The bright lights, like a string of yellow copper bells, seem to be still hanging on the 1,450-meter-long Central Street, which starts from the Songhua River Flood Control Victory Memorial Tower in the north and ends at Jingwei Street in the south.

;

;"On some side streets, it is quieter. The light of the street lamps imprints the shadows of the leaves on the road. The aging Russians are talking about the good days that no longer exist. ... In You may think it is ugly during the day, but on a beautiful night, you put beautiful clothes on everything, and everything seems to be beautiful." The shorter streets in Jin's works form a fish-like formation with the Central Street. The bone-shaped street layout supported the "enchanting" appearance of this street after the completion of the China-Eastern Railway in 1903, where foreign merchants gathered and shops were dotted; especially in 1924, the Russian engineer Komut Rashok was responsible for the design and supervision of the construction. After the rectangular bread-shaped granite pavement was replaced, the bread stone road replaced the muddy dirt road. The appearance of the street was greatly changed, and it became rich and luxurious. In the 1930s, Central Street had become an architectural art gallery and an international architectural expo. Both sides of the street Most of them are Baroque, Gothic, Renaissance and other styles of buildings, creating a beautiful skyline; there are many foreign stores, dance halls and cinemas, restaurants and bars... At that time, Central Street became a place of pilgrimage for commodity fetishism.

;

;;

;

;China Street (today’s Central Street) is beginning to take shape;(Zhang Yameng/Photo);

;

;On the streets paved with square stones, the sound of Victorian carriages has long since passed into the twilight of history. Only the pieces of breadstone that have been worn away by the passing years are still shining brightly on today's pedestrian streets. Visitors tell stories about the smoky past of the long street - on summer evenings, the brilliant sunset shines slantingly on more than 70 European-style and imitation European-style buildings, and they seem to have their own unique character.

;

;;Music: Soul of the North;

;

;Of course, there is also the Madiel popsicle that is essential when visiting Central Street - Matsuura 1918 West, which was renovated in the Matsuura Yoko Building. Diagonally across from the restaurant is Madiel's cold drink hall. Nowadays, "Madiel" can be eaten all over the country at different prices, but it is said that they are all "a bit uninteresting". You still have to buy 5 yuan a piece here, which is made in the front store and in the back factory, without wrapping paper, which is the most authentic: In winter, the daily sales here start at 10,000 sticks, and sales usually explode on New Year's Day, with 30,000 to 40,000 sticks sold a day. During the peak tourist season in Harbin, "Naked Madiel in the North Wind" is one of the features of Central Street. Everyone wants to "cool themselves down to the bottom."

;

;After nibbling on the popsicles, you can turn around and taste the hot red cabbage soup, mandarin fish in milk and delicious canned shrimps at the Madier Western Restaurant - since the Russians started cooking pots in Tianjia in 1898 With the opening of railway canteens, Russian-style Western food began to take root in China. In the Central Street area alone, there are Tadaos and Huamei (;former Mars There are more than 30 Western restaurants such as Western Food Tea Shop;) and Madiel.

;

;The food and delicacies are endlessly memorable, especially when accompanied by music - whether in Matsuura, Huamei, or Madiel’s own Western restaurant on the first floor, Madiel can often be heard in the summer The music show on the balcony on the second floor of the hotel includes violin music, saxophone performance or bel canto solo. Artists who appeared to be from Central and Eastern Europe took turns performing hard, attracting tourists to stop and adding a lot of excitement to Central Street. It was also reminiscent of their "predecessors", the foreign musicians who gathered here in the first half of the 20th century. : In 1936, singers Alexander Wilkinsky and Fedor Chaliapin came to Kazakhstan to hold a concert; in 1938, 10-year-old Helmut Stern came to China with his parents, and at the age of 14 He held a concert in Harbin and later joined the Harbin Symphony Orchestra, which was founded in 1908 and was once known as the "First Symphony Orchestra in the Far East." After going to Israel in 1948, he became the chief violinist of the Berlin Philharmonic... Starting in the 1920s, Foreigners in Harbin have founded nearly 30 music schools. The strong music atmosphere that has lasted for a century has become an important cornerstone for Harbin to be awarded the title of "City of Music" by the United Nations.

;

;;

;

;Old view of Madier Hotel;(Zhang Yameng/picture);

;

;Madiel Hotel Er's balcony music show is just a small note in the "Music City". "In the Madier Hotel, that hotel with a big stage and a luxurious hall, a play was organized between the movie screenings and a dance program was started... I happily put aside the boring rehearsals of the troupe and went to them specifically There." Dancer and poet Larisa Angell lived in China for 34 years and often performed at the Madier Hotel founded by Russian Jew Joseph Kasper in 1906. Her beautiful figure and summer Photos of Ryabin and Wilkinski, as well as tableware, lamps, electrical appliances, accessories, and promotional posters of Madier Cinema, together form the "historical and cultural corridor" in the hotel; during her years of activeness in Harbin , this very ancient building on Central Street is regarded as "having the most luxurious ballroom and restaurant, the most modern and comfortable guest rooms."

;

;At that time, the scenery of the Madier Hotel was unparalleled, until the "Casper Kidnapping Case" that shocked Harbin in 1933 came to an abrupt end. On the evening of August 24 of that year, after dining at the Madier Western Restaurant, Simon, the son of Joseph Kasper Sr., was kidnapped by the Inspector General of the Kazakhstan Police Department, Martinov, and 15 gangsters; on December 3, Simon’s body was found It was discovered in Xiaoling near Harbin, causing an outcry. The following year, the sad old Joseph took his wife and children and left for France. Soon he died of illness in Paris. Madier also declined from glory to glory. Only the leather bag left by Casper in the "Historical and Cultural Corridor" of the hotel can be traced. Talk about being a witness.

;

;On November 25, 1948, representatives of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and democrats such as Shen Junru and Zhang Bojun in Kazakhstan reached an "Agreement on Various Issues Concerning the Convening of a New Political Consultative Conference" in the No. 1 conference room of the Madier Hotel. . At that time, the 73-year-old "Heng Lao" Shen Junru lived in a hotel and often went for walks along the Songhua River. He saw the rare scene of the river freezing and then thawing again, so he wrote a poem: "After the river freezes, I see rushing water and snow. Even the tide is not full. The atmosphere of the earth also changes with people and events. From now on, geese from the north no longer have to go south."

;

;;

;

;The Dormition Church in the Cultural Park;(Meng Huizhong/Photo);

;

;The south bank of the Songhua River at the end of Central Street is Stalin Park, a narrow and long "riverside". From here you can You can enjoy the scenery of the river that is sometimes rapid and sometimes gentle, touch the soul of the northern city, and feel the carnival atmosphere of the "Harbin Summer" concert that has been held for more than 60 years in the summer.

;

;Rivers and songs flow into the distance, deposited over hundreds of years. Harbin is like a sponge, absorbing all sounds, while those mottled old buildings become witnesses of the city's historical changes.

;

;In 2020, during an academic conference, Li Wei (pseudonym), a professor at the School of Physical Education of Shihezi University, casually agreed to a friend’s request for a paper name. It was a paper related to swimming. In 2021, a third-party agency discovered that the paper was suspected of being synthesized by reverse translation software and reported it to the Ministry of Education for confirmation, and the Ministry of Education fed back the situation to Shihezi University. The school launched an investigation and sent a letter to the other school, and found that Li Wei, the corresponding author, had not previously known about the existence of this article.

;

;Li Wei was punished and could not participate in various project applications and evaluations for three years. During the ongoing self-examination of academic misconduct in college theses and the cleanup of false claims, Li Wei was reported again.

;

;Beginning in late May 2023, many universities have successively announced the launch of self-examination and cleanup of academic misconduct in papers, requiring self-examination and cleanup of academic papers since January 2018. Previously, on April 27, 2023, the General Office of the Ministry of Science and Technology issued a self-examination notice, requiring universities and scientific research institutes to self-examine and clean up common academic misconduct including plagiarism, plagiarism, forged peer reviews, ghostwriting and investment, etc.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters noted that the main purpose of self-examination is to reduce the stock of academic misconduct papers and strive to curb the increase. ;;

;

;This is a self-examination operation that was not intended to be made public. Southern Weekend reporters learned from people close to the Ministry of Science and Technology that the notice only became known to the outside world because two universities posted the notice as an attachment online.

;

;;The self-examination document is “not public ;;”;

;

;According to the notices issued by each school, the main objects of this self-examination are These are all academic papers published by teachers and students of the school as the first signed unit. The focus areas of self-examination are basically the same, and they are all relatively common academic misconduct. It mainly includes six categories: plagiarism, plagiarism, and duplication of publications; forging corresponding authors, forging or manipulating peer reviews; forging, fabricating, and tampering with experimental data and pictures, using one picture for multiple purposes, and selective use; buying, selling, and ghostwriting papers; and purchasing experiments. Research data; nominal phenomena.

;

;According to the notice of the Ministry of Science and Technology, universities and scientific research institutes in all provinces should carry out self-examination and clean-up work. However, according to incomplete statistics from Southern Weekend reporters, only nearly 30 universities, including Shihezi University, Qinghai University, and Beijing University of Civil Engineering and Architecture, have issued this notice on their official websites.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters learned from people close to the Ministry of Science and Technology that the aforementioned Ministry of Science and Technology notice was originally a non-public document, but it became known to the outside world after two universities posted it online as an attachment to the notice. In fact, the notice documents issued by the Jiangsu and Anhui Provincial Science and Technology Departments did state "This matter will not be made public" at the end.

;

;This is a top-down campaign to investigate academic misconduct. Southern Weekend reporters tried to contact nearly 30 universities that publicly released the notice. Among them, Shihezi University, Qinghai University, Southwest University of Science and Technology and Yanshan University were interviewed.

;

;At present, different universities have slightly different self-examination methods. However, they all adopt the method of teachers filling in forms and reporting by themselves. The content of the form mainly contains the personal information of the self-examination teacher, such as position, school, research direction, etc., as well as paper information, including paper title, DOI/PMID, publication time, publication journal, author category, academic violations, etc. The college’s statistical researchers are required to screen academic papers published within the verification period, identify academic papers with the above six conditions, put forward rectification suggestions, and form a self-examination work summary report.

;

;Specific inspection methods can be roughly divided into focused spot inspections and comprehensive inspections.

;

;Shihezi University and Yanshan University adopted a comprehensive inventory approach. A teacher from the Scientific Research Office of Shihezi University told Southern Weekend reporters that they had comprehensively checked 8,671 papers signed by teachers at the school within the time limit. The school organized an investigation team. The teachers first filled in the self-examination form, and then the college compiled and submitted it. Finally, the school's scientific research office reported it to the XPCC Education Bureau.

;

;A person in charge of the Social Sciences Office of Yanshan University said that after the announcement, the secondary college organized teachers to conduct self-examinations and submit self-examination forms and commitment letters. The college issues a self-examination report based on the self-examination situation, which is finally summarized and reported by the Social Science Office. Southern Weekend reporters contacted some colleges of the school to inquire about the implementation status. Among them, a staff member from the office of the School of Construction Engineering and Mechanics confirmed the statement of the aforementioned person in charge.

;

;Qinghai University and Southwest University of Science and Technology adopt focused spot checks.

;

;A teacher in charge of Qinghai University said that the school's Science and Technology Office takes the lead and adopts a two-level system. First, the college's professor committee organizes self-examination, and then the school inspection office conducts random inspections. Specific to different disciplines, the degree of rigor varies. For example, due to the subject characteristics of medicine, academic misconduct is prone to occur. The school conducted a census of more than 150 papers published by teachers from the clinical medical school between January 2022 and May 2023, while other disciplines were Spot checks.

;

;虽然通知中要求是2018年1月至2023年5月，但前述负责老师表示，青海大学每年都有两次检查，分别在期中和年终，因此此次将2022年至今的论文作为重点再查一遍。

;

;The reason why he adopted the method of focused spot checks was that Qinghai University’s strong disciplines are mainly agriculture and forestry. “Due to the plateau specificity, many papers do not have experiments and data, and cannot be copied from other places. Therefore, The probability of academic misconduct will be relatively small."

;

;Spot checks are conducted on a proportional basis. He gave an example, based on the total number of papers published by the college within the period, for example, 50 papers were published, and 10 papers were randomly checked, including the original data of the scientific research and whether the person named on the paper was a member of the research team.

;

;A teacher from the Science and Technology Development Department of Southwest University of Science and Technology said that they mainly screen key papers, and others mainly rely on feedback and reports from school teachers and other staff.

;

;;“;;Almost no problems were found;;”;

;

;This kind of large-scale self-examination has little impact on This is the first time for many universities.

;

;Relevant officials from Southwest University of Science and Technology and Yanshan University stated that similar large-scale system self-examination work had not been carried out before. The person in charge of Southwest University of Science and Technology emphasized that issues such as academic misconduct and pseudonymity were previously mainly investigated and handled through reports from others.

;

;It is worth noting that in most notices, the self-examination time left for teachers is about one month. At present, the self-examination work has basically been completed at the school level.

;

;Some self-examination window periods are shorter. The Science and Technology Office of Shijiazhuang Railway University issued a notice on July 26, 2023, requiring each college to complete the self-examination and cleanup work before July 30. If problems are found, a summary form should be filled out in a timely manner and submitted to the Science and Technology Office, and remedial measures such as corrections and retractions should be taken, and "no feedback after the deadline will be deemed as a paper without academic misconduct." They gave each college only four days for self-examination.

;

;Judging from the feedback from the four schools interviewed, the result of the self-examination was “almost no problems.”

;

;燕山大学的老师表示，自查工作在7月底就已完成，“没发现任何问题”，并强调，相关结果已经上报省教育厅。 Teachers from the Science and Technology Development Department of Southwest University of Science and Technology also said that the school has completed a preliminary screening and found no relevant violations.

;

;As for whether a self-examination report needs to be issued, a staff member from the office of the School of Architectural Engineering and Mechanics of Yanshan University said, “The school only requires us to fill in a self-examination form and issue a report if there are any problems, but our school should no problem".

;

;Similarly, the teacher in charge of Qinghai University said that since inspections were organized twice a year before, no serious academic misconduct was found this time.

;

;The only exception is Shihezi University. They self-identified three illegal articles. The violations were improper naming, purchasing data, and repeated publication. They belonged to the School of Physical Education, School of Medicine, and School of Animal Science and Technology.

;

;Among them, the improper listing and purchase data are illegal articles that have been investigated before this inspection. Although notices from the science and technology departments of many provinces stated that papers that have been investigated and dealt with may not be included in the scope of this self-examination. However, the teacher in charge of the Scientific Research Office of Shihezi University believes that it "still serves as a warning."

;

;How to punish after investigation?

;

;The General Office of the Ministry of Science and Technology stated that if problems are found during self-examination and cleanup, scientific researchers must promptly report to the unit and take remedial measures such as corrections and retractions. Those who comply with the lenient treatment circumstances specified in Article 34 of the "Rules for the Investigation and Handling of Untrustworthy Conduct in Scientific Research" may be given lenient treatment in accordance with the regulations; those who conceal or make false reports shall be punished in accordance with Article 3 of the "Rules for the Investigation and Handling of Untrustworthy Conduct in Scientific Research" Article 15 and other relevant regulations will be dealt with seriously and publicly announced.

;

;Teachers from the Scientific Research Office of Shihezi University explained that the school has criticized and educated the teachers involved and required them not to apply for projects within three years. They are not allowed to be prioritized and receive talent titles, nor can they apply for science and technology projects. award.

;

;Shihezi University will take lenient treatment for those who took the initiative to report in this self-examination.动物科技学院张小千、李劼在2019年发表《培养温度对嗜热链球菌抑制法检测结果的影响》一文。涉事老师当时分别向《黑龙江畜牧兽医》和《中国奶牛》两家期刊投递论文，其中《黑龙江畜牧兽医》为核心期刊。 2019年5月，《中国奶牛》率先将论文发表，4个月后，《黑龙江畜牧兽医》刊出此文。

;

;发现重复发表后，论文作者曾反复与《中国奶牛》期刊负责人交涉，要求对方撤稿，但被拒。直到2023年7月，论文作者借由科技部的相关通知进行协商，对方最终同意撤稿。

;

;石河子大学科研处的老师表示，由于论文作者主动报告，且此前数次联系杂志社撤稿，因此处理方式上就从轻，仅批评教育。

;

;;为何自查？ ;

;

;为何会有此次自上而下的大规模自查？

;

;前述科技部通知中对此的解释为，压实各单位主体责任，削减学术不端论文存量，着力遏制增量，引导科研人员强化科研诚信意识等。

;

;简而言之，自查的核心在于消除存量、遏制增量。前述接近科技部的人士解释，比如某位科研人员十年前买了一篇文章，要么已经发表用以申报职称获利，要么一直没用。如果没用的话，现在各种严打，只能憋着，一旦发表，没准哪天就会爆雷。不管怎样，他们都会忐忑不安。而自查清理是很好的机会，“就是给这些犯过错误的科研人员一个机会，不论当时是无知也好、侥幸也罢”。

;

;同时，也是给科研人员一个自查梳理的机会。 “梳理一下总归是好事，增强诚信意识，摸清家底，不至于出现被挂名却不自知的情况。”

;

;至于遏制增量，“如果知道大家都在盯着这个事，他们以后也不会再干了”。

;

;此外，前述接近科技部的人士提及，由于是自查，有从轻减轻情形，“如果没有从中获利，甚至可以不予追究，不过批评肯定是要的”。他认为，自查更多起到教育和震慑的作用。

;

;实际上，这并非首次开展清查。南方周末记者了解到，2022年也曾在部委层面开展过这项工作，目的是让相关部门和地方层面了解到部委对科研诚信工作的重视，但当时“并未公开”。

;

;对于可能存在瞒报情况，前述接近科技部的人士表示，如果自查时没问题，而将来查出问题，且处于2018年至今的时间段内，那一定会加重处理，“这相当于对抗诚信检查”。

;

;如果拉长时间线看，自查背后，是近年逐渐多发的论文撤稿情况和趋严的科研诚信管理措施。

;

;2017年4月20日，学术出版巨头施普林格发布声明称，107篇已发表于《肿瘤生物学》的论文因涉嫌同行评审造假而被撤稿。而这些涉事论文全部来自中国，发表时间为2012-2016年。

;

;中国科协当时发表意见，希望施普林格出版集团能够尽快完善内控机制，加强对期刊的管理，把问题论文处理在发表前，而不是发表之后一撤了之，同时高度警惕以经济利益为目的、与“第三方”机构有勾结的“掠夺性期刊”。

;

;2023年1月15日，美国恒祥咨询（Healsan Consulting LLC）发布《2022年SCI论文撤稿简报》。简报显示，截至2022年12月31日，全球范围内总共有41642篇SCI撤稿，其中中国19421篇。具体到2022年1月1日至2022年12月31日期间，全球有5488篇SCI撤稿，其中中国的撤稿数量为2879篇。

;

;对科研诚信的重视程度也日益提高。 2018年5月，中共中央办公厅、国务院办公厅印发《关于进一步加强科研诚信建设的若干意见》。意见强调，要严厉打击严重违背科研诚信要求的行为，建立终身追究制度，一经发现，随时调查处理。这是首次以中央发文的形式，将科研诚信工作的重要性提到极高程度。

;

;此后，2020年，科技进步法修订，进一步明确了科研失信的相关惩戒措施。 2022年，科技部等22个部门对《科研诚信案件调查处理规则（试行）》进行修订，使得科研失信行为的调查处理工作有了更为具体的处理规则。

;

;与此同时，从2018年开始，科技部每年陆续公布科研失信行为调查处理结果，2017至2019年各有一批处理结果，2020年有两批，2021年和2022年则公布了四批。

;

;此轮自查之后将有后续。前述接近科技部的人士表示，尤其是一点问题都没查出来的，恰恰在重点关注范围内。 “这次盖着单位的红章来，一篇有问题的文章都没有，但如果之后频繁撤稿，或者被调查出现问题，那单位的主体责任肯定落实不到位，到时一定严肃查处。”他表示。
